snippetFileDependent:
# The following code snippet assumes that you have used the 'Download Data' 
# button to download a CSV file with the relevant Data Commons data to your 
# system. The code reads the downloaded CSV file and merges it into your data

# Please fill in the following constants according to your folder/file names
wd <- "~/Desktop/r_wd"
user_filename <- "user_data.csv"
dcw_filename <- "dcw_data.csv"
user_colname = "zip"
dcw_colname = "zipCode"
output_filename <- "merged_data.csv"

# Load the 'dplyr' package. If it's not installed, run install.packages("dplyr")
library(dplyr)

# Set working directory
setwd(wd)

# Read the user's data
df1 <- read.csv(user_filename, header = T)

# Read the downloaded Data Commons CSV file into a new data frame
df2 <- read.csv(dcw_filename, header=T)

# Merge the two data frames using the appropriate column names
merged_df <- left_join(df1, df2, by=setNames(nm=user_colname, dcw_colname))

# Export merged data to CSV
write.csv(merged_df, output_filename, row.names = F)
snippetFileIndependent:
# The following code snippet doesn't require downloading any data to your 
# system. The code retrieves the selected data directly from Data Commons
# using the Data Commons REST APIs and integrates them into your data. 
# This option is more suitable for working environments that don't allow 
# storing any downloaded data into the local system.

# Please fill in the following constants according to your folder/file names
wd <- "~/Desktop/r_wd"
user_filename <- "user_data.csv"
user_colname <- "zip"
dcw_colname <- "zipCode"
output_filename <- "merged_data.csv"

# Input data
zips <- c($INDEX_VARIABLE_VALUES)
statvars <- c($DC_VARIABLE_NAMES)

# Load the 'dplyr' package. If it's not installed, run install.packages("dplyr")
library(dplyr)

# Set working directory
setwd(wd)

# Read the user's data
df1 <- read.csv(user_filename, header = T)

# Get the latest statistical data from DataCommons.org
df2 <- latest_statistical_data(zips, statvars)

# Merge the two data frames using the appropriate column names
merged_df <- left_join(df1, df2, by=setNames(nm=user_colname, dcw_colname))

# Export merged data to CSV
write.csv(merged_df, output_filename, row.names = F)
